com.google.enterprise.connector.spi

Interface ConnectorFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleConnectorFactory

    public interface ConnectorFactory
    This factory provides a mechanism by which ConnectorType.validateConfig may create instances of the connector for the purpose of validation. Connector instances created by the factory are not added to the Connector Manager's list of running connectors and do not have an on-disk representation.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Connector makeConnector(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
      Make a Connector instance of the ConnectorType that owns this ConnectorFactory instance using the supplied Map of configuration properties.

    • Method Detail

      • makeConnector

        Connector makeConnector(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
                        throws RepositoryException
        Make a Connector instance of the ConnectorType that owns this ConnectorFactory instance using the supplied Map of configuration properties.
        Parameters:
        config - a Map of configuration properties. If null, the Map that was passed to validateConfig is used.
        Returns:
        a Connector instance, instantiated by the Connector Manager in exactly the same way as it would if this config were valid and persisted.
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if the Connector construction fails for any reason.
